text: input_data Data frame analyse. Must contain POSIXct field called date. vars Explanatory variables use. variables used build gbm::gbm() model. Note model must include trend component. Several variables can automatically calculated (see prepData() details). pollutant name variable apply meteorological normalisation . sam.size number random samples extract data model building. possible use full data set, data sets spanning years model building can take long time run. Additionally, diminishing returns terms model accuracy. sam.size greater number number rows data, number rows data used instead. n.trees Number trees fit. shrinkage shrinkage parameter applied tree expansion. Also known learning rate step-size reduction; 0.001 0.1 usually work, smaller learning rate typically requires trees. Default 0.1. interaction.depth Integer specifying maximum depth tree (.e., highest level variable interactions allowed). value 1 implies additive model, value 2 implies model 2-way interactions, etc. Default 5. bag.fraction fraction training set observations randomly selected propose next tree expansion. introduces randomness model fit. bag.fraction < 1 running model twice result similar different. n.minobsinnode Integer specifying minimum number observations terminal nodes trees. Note actual number observations, total weight. cv.folds Number cross-validation folds perform. cv.folds > 1 gbm::gbm(), addition usual fit, perform cross-validation, calculate estimate generalization error returned cv.error. simulate original time series randomly sampled replacement? default FALSE. Setting simulate = TRUE can useful estimating model uncertainties. case models run multiple times B = 1 different value seed e.g. seed = runif(1). B Number bootstrap simulations partial dependence plots. n.core Number cores use parallel processing. seed Random number seed reproducibility returned model. progress using multiple cores, show progress indicator bootstrap simulations?

Note local time zone need supplied (see local.tz). purpose using local time rather UTC emissions can vary strongly local time rather UTC. weekday - day week. trend - trend calculated decimal year. week - week year. Useful taking account long-term seasonal variations. jday - Julian Day number. month - month year. Useful taking account long-term seasonal variations.

code: testMod(   input_data,   vars = c("trend", "ws", "wd", "hour", "weekday", "air_temp"),   pollutant = "nox",   train.frac = 0.8,   n.trees = NA,   shrinkage = 0.1,   interaction.depth = 5,   bag.fraction = 0.5,   n.minobsinnode = 10,   cv.folds = 5,   seed = 123,   plot = TRUE )

title: Function to test different meteorological normalisation models. ‚Äî testMod
text: input_data Data frame analyse. Must contain POSIXct field called date. vars Explanatory variables use. variables used build gbm::gbm() model. Note model must include trend component. Several variables can automatically calculated (see prepData() details). pollutant name variable apply meteorological normalisation . train.frac Fraction data train model . model tested withheld 0.2 proportion. n.trees Number trees use. n.trees = NA function conduct cross-validation calculate optimum number. shrinkage shrinkage parameter applied tree expansion. Also known learning rate step-size reduction; 0.001 0.1 usually work, smaller learning rate typically requires trees. Default 0.1. interaction.depth Integer specifying maximum depth tree (.e., highest level variable interactions allowed). value 1 implies additive model, value 2 implies model 2-way interactions, etc. Default 5. bag.fraction fraction training set observations randomly selected propose next tree expansion. introduces randomness model fit. bag.fraction < 1 running model twice result similar different. n.minobsinnode Integer specifying minimum number observations terminal nodes trees. Note actual number observations, total weight. cv.folds Number cross-validation folds perform. cv.folds > 1 gbm::gbm(), addition usual fit, perform cross-validation, calculate estimate generalization error returned cv.error. seed Random number seed reproducibility returned model. plot default, TRUE, automatically prints plot two tables statistics review model output. FALSE disables behaviour.

title: deweather 0.7.2
text: plotPD() now holds functionality plotting partial dependency plots, deprecating plotAllPD(). (#12) default, partial dependencies plotted (similar plotAllPD()). variable argument allows users specify specific variables (similar old plotPD()). Multiple variables can provided. col argument controls colour PD plots. multiple colours specified, repeated variables visualised. polar.wd argument optionally show wind direction PD polar coordinates. plotInfluence() (previously gmbInf()) gained two new arguments: sort (defaults TRUE) sort variables mean influence, ordering values y-axis. col controls colours. Users can specify var (makes bar different colour) mean (colours x-axis values). Many plotting functions received plot argument suppress printing plots, bringing deweather line recent versions openair. testMod() invisibly returns table statistics along plot. (#9) testMod() now prints one plot one table rather one plot two tables. ensures printed plot less distorted. lists returned plotPD() now named, making easier index. (#10) deweather model objects now nicer print(), plot(), head(), tail() summary() methods.
